meta.name: Find the Cheapest Flights Automatically with Bright Data & n8n

parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# ğŸ§³ âœˆï¸ **Flight Price Scraper from Skiplagged using Bright Data**

This automation helps you extract **cheap flight prices** from [Skiplagged.com](https://skiplagged.com) using **Bright Data** and automatically logs those prices into a **Google Sheet** for review and tracking.

---

## ğŸ”¹ **SECTION 1: Getting the Flight Prices**

*Combining: Manual Trigger + HTTP Request (Bright Data)*

### ğŸŒ©ï¸ 1. **Manual Trigger**

* **ğŸ§  What it does**: Starts the workflow when you click **Execute Workflow** in n8n.
* **ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« For beginners**: Think of it like a **start button**. No schedule, just run it manually whenever you want to check for deals.

---

### ğŸŒ 2. **Fetch Flight Details from Skiplagged via Bright Data**

* **ğŸ”§ Node Type**: `HTTP Request` (POST)

* **ğŸŒ What's happening**:

  * Uses Bright Data Web Unlocker to **bypass bot protection** and fetch HTML content from Skiplagged.
  * Youâ€™re sending a POST request to `https://api.brightdata.com/request`, asking Bright Data to open:
    `https://skiplagged.com/flights/DUB/LON/2024-06-30` (or a dynamic route).
  * Headers & proxy make it **look like a real browser**.

* **ğŸ’¡ Why itâ€™s useful**:

  * **Skiplagged is tricky to scrape** directly, but Bright Data makes it easy.
  * You get the **entire HTML** of the search results page, ready to extract price info.

* âœ… **Returns**: HTML of the page (not yet structured â€” we handle that next)

---

## ğŸ”¹ **SECTION 2: Extracting & Storing Flight Prices**

*Combining: HTML Node + Google Sheets*

### ğŸ–¥ï¸ 3. **HTML Extract (extractHtmlContent)**

* **ğŸ”§ Node Type**: `HTML Extract`

* **ğŸ¯ Goal**: Pull out **all flight prices** from the raw HTML.

* **How it works**:

  * Uses a selector like `.flights-landing__flight-price` to find every element that matches.
  * **Returns multiple values** if "Return All Matches" is enabled.

* ğŸ§  **Beginner Note**: Imagine your browser looking for all `<div class="flights-landing__flight-price">`. This is like **copying all price tags off the screen**.

* âœ… **Returns**:

  ```json
  [
    "$104", "$117", "$99", "$88"
  ]
  ```

---

### ğŸ“Š 4. **Google Sheets (append: sheet)**

* **ğŸ”§ Node Type**: `Google Sheets Append`

* **ğŸ“‹ What it does**: Appends each flight price as a new row in your spreadsheet.

* **ğŸ› ï¸ Tip**: Make sure your sheet has one column titled something like `Price` and authentication is set up.

* âŒ **Error Warning**: If this node is red, likely issues are:

  * Missing Google credentials
  * Sheet name doesnâ€™t match
  * Field mapping mismatch

* âœ… **Returns**: New rows in your sheet like:

| Price |
| ----- |
| \$88  |
| \$99  |
| \$104 |

---

## ğŸŒŸ Final Thoughts: Why This Is Powerful

âœ… **Perfect for spontaneous travelers** who want to grab last-minute deals.
âœ… **Low-cost** thanks to free tools (n8n + Google Sheets) and flexible Bright Data usage.
âœ… **Easy to expand**: Add logic to filter cheapest flight, add Telegram/email alert, or schedule it daily.

---

## ğŸ§­ Next Steps You Could Add

* ğŸ“… Add a **Cron node** to automate daily checks.
* ğŸ“¬ Add **Telegram or Email node** to notify when price < \$100.
* ğŸ”§ Use **Set node** to make route and date dynamic.

---
